title: CNA - AI Maturity Model for Government Agencies
description: Comprehensive framework with 450 milestones across seven dimensions to assess and advance AI maturity. Helps agencies understand current maturity levels, identify specific objectives, and create actionable roadmaps for incremental capability growth.

title: Berkeley Public Policy Journal - AI Maturity and Readiness Model for Governments
description: Four-stage maturity model (Explorer, Experimenter, Performer, Leader) defining progression from pilots to scaled AI. Addresses why both technical infrastructure and governance readiness are essential before scaling AI adoption.

title: Guidehouse - AI Readiness Maturity Model for Government Agencies
description: Seven-dimension assessment framework with case study of federal agency addressing fragmented AI efforts. Provides practical path from isolated pilots to enterprise-wide approach with specific projects, timelines, and ownership structures.

title: Deloitte Insights - Scaling AI in Government
description: Analysis of why governments struggle to move from pilots to scale, highlighting the 'pilot trap' where organizations remain beginners despite successful small projects. Provides evidence-based insights on organizational capabilities needed for AI at scale.

title: US White House Archives - Digital Government Strategy: Building a 21st Century Platform
description: Articulates shift from siloed pilots to secure, interoperable architecture from conception. Addresses common standards, information-centric approaches, and coordinated privacy/security for government-wide digital transformation.

title: Public Sector Network - Interoperability and Data Exchange for Government Transformation
description: Explores technical, organizational, legal, and political dimensions of interoperability at the base registry level. Provides guidance on standardized data models, legacy system modernization, and stakeholder collaboration.

title: CSIS - Unpacking Digital Public Infrastructure and Its Importance
description: Explains foundational, interoperable infrastructure that allows organizations to build upon it while maintaining open standards. Addresses governance models balancing public accountability with innovation and private sector participation.

title: OECD - Enabling Digital Innovation in Government (GovTech Policy Framework)
description: Identifies that only 24-27% of countries have common frameworks for interoperability, API management, or digital service standards. Provides a framework for creating enabling conditions and scaling GovTech solutions without stifling innovation.
